Title: Windows 10 has reached end of support
The October 2025 Windows security update is now available
Retiring the “Refresh all on page” button in OneNote Meeting Details pane by end of 2025
Summary: The "Refresh all on page" button in OneNote's Meeting Details pane will be retired between November 15 and December 15, 2025. Users can update meeting info by selecting the meeting again from the right pane. No admin action is needed; notify users and update documentation accordingly.

Title: (Updated) Streamlined file preview experience in Microsoft 365 Copilot app for iOS
Services: Microsoft 365 suite, Microsoft 365 apps, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365)
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot app for iOS will shift to AI-powered file previews and chat for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, directing editing to standalone apps. File management will move to OneDrive. Rollout begins September 2025 with phased updates for iPhone and iPad. Organizations should prepare users and update training accordingly.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Viva Copilot Analytics launches new agent dashboard
Tags: Updated message, New feature, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft Viva Copilot Analytics introduces a new Agent Dashboard for detailed insights on agent adoption and Copilot credit usage. Rolling out from November 2025 (preview) to February 2026 (general availability), it targets organizations with 50+ Copilot licenses, enhancing adoption tracking and management within Viva Insights.

Title: Microsoft Power Platform: AI Builder capacity packs end of sale and transition to Copilot Studio credits
Tags: Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Services: Power Apps in Microsoft 365, Microsoft Power Automate in Microsoft 365
Summary: Microsoft is ending AI Builder service credits sales on November 1, 2025, transitioning to Copilot Studio credits for Power Platform and Dynamics 365 AI capabilities. Existing credits remain until expiration, with full transition by November 1, 2026. Admins should prepare for licensing changes and update internal processes accordingly.

Title: (Updated) Realtime voice is now available in M365 Copilot Chat and M365 Copilot
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Realtime voice chat is now available in Microsoft 365 Copilot, enabling hands-free, natural interactions for brainstorming, searching, and more. The feature rolls out worldwide starting September 2025, is on by default, requires no admin setup, and supports iOS, Android, Web, Windows, and Mac platforms.
